tit.e: Shiki (rank of government offices under ritsuryo system)
Shiki (a rank in government offices under ritsuryo system)
tit.cmt: rank of government offices --> a rank in government offices
tit.e: Shiki (a rank in government offices under ritsuryo system)

sen.j: 職(しき)は律令制における官司の等級の一つである。
sen.e: Shiki was a rank of government offices under the ritsuryo system.
Shiki was a rank in government offices under the ritsuryo system.
sen.cmt: a rank of government offices --> a rank in government offices
sen.e: Shiki was a rank in government offices under the ritsuryo system.

sen.j: 職は寮 (律令制)や司と共に主に省（中務省・宮内省の二省）などのもとで事務を行う組織､また特別地域（京など）を統治する組織である。
sen.e: Shiki was an organization to take charge of clerical work along with Tsukasa (also known as Ryo) and Tsukasa (also known as Shi) and to rule special areas (like Kyoto) mainly under the ministries (two ministries of Nakatsukasasho and Kunaisho.)

Shiki was an organization to take charge of clerical work along with Ryo (ritsuryo system) and Tsukasa (also known as Shi) and to rule special areas (like Kyoto), mainly under the ministries (two ministries of Nakatsukasasho and Kunaisho).

Shiki was an organization to take charge of clerical work along with Ryo (ritsuryo system) and Tsukasa (also known as Shi) and to rule special areas (like Kyoto), mainly under the ministries (two ministries of Nakatsukasasho and Kunaisho).

sen.j: 寮や司よりも格が高く上級機関に対してやや強い独立性を持っている。
sen.e: Shiki ranked higher than Tsukasa (also known as Ryo) and Tsukasa (also known as Shi) and had relatively independent of the higher organizations.
Shiki was ranked higher than Ryo and Tsukasa and relatively independent of higher organizations.
Shiki was ranked higher than Ryo and Tsukasa and relatively independent of higher organizations.

sen.j: 基本職員である四等官は大夫（長官）－亮（次官）－進（判官）－属（主典）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Shitokan, the regular officials, were called Daibu (Kami) - Suke - Jo - Sakan.
Shitokan, the regular officials, were called Daibu (Kami) - Suke - Jo - Sakan.
Shitokan, the regular officials, were called Daibu (Kami) - Suke - Jo - Sakan.

sen.j: 春宮坊は四等官の構成､官位相当などがまったく同じであることから職の一種と考えられている。
sen.e: Since Togubo had the combination of Shitokan and their corresponding court ranks were the same as Shiki, it was considered as a kind of Shiki.
Since Togubo and Shiki had completely the same configuration of Shitokan, corresponding court ranks and the like, Togubo is considered to have been a kind of Shiki.
Since Togubo and Shiki had completely the same configuration of Shitokan, corresponding court ranks and the like, Togubo is considered to have been a kind of Shiki.

sen.j: 職は官位相当などによってさらに二等級は分類される。
sen.e: Shiki can be classified into two ranks according to the court ranks of the officials and the like.
Shiki can be classified further into two ranks according to the court ranks of the officials and the like.
Shiki can be classified further into two ranks according to the court ranks of the officials and the like.

sen.j: 大職四等官の構成は大夫（従四位下）-亮（従五位下）-大進（従六位上）-少進（従六位下）-大属（正八位下）-少属（従八位上）
sen.e: Shitokan of Daishiki were Daibu (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) - Suke (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) - Daijo (Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) - Shojo (Junior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade) - Daisakan (Senior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade) - Shosakan (Junior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade.)

Shitokan of Daishiki were Daibu (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) - Suke (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) - Daijo (Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) - Shojo (Junior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade) - Daisakan (Senior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade) - Shosakan (Junior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade.)

Shitokan of Daishiki were Daibu (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) - Suke (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) - Daijo (Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) - Shojo (Junior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade) - Daisakan (Senior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade) - Shosakan (Junior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade.)
Chugushiki (Nakatsukasasho)
Chugushiki (Nakatsukasasho)
Chugushiki (Nakatsukasasho)
Shurishiki (Ryoge, Independent)
Shurishiki (Ryoge, Independent)
Shurishiki (Ryoge, Independent)
Togubo (Independent)
Togubo (Independent)
Togubo (Independent)

sen.j: 小職四等官の構成は大夫（正五位上）-亮（従五位下）-大進（従六位下）-少進（正七位上）-大属（正八位下）-少属（従八位上）
sen.e: Shitokan of Shoshiki were Daibu (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) - Suke (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) - Daijo (Junior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade) - Shojo (Senior Seventh Rank, Upper Grade) - Daisakan (Senior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade) - Shosakan (Junior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade.)

Shitokan of Shoshiki included Daibu (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) - Suke (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) - Daijo (Junior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade) - Shojo (Senior Seventh Rank, Upper Grade) - Daisakan (Senior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade) - Shosakan (Junior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade).

Shitokan of Shoshiki included Daibu (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) - Suke (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) - Daijo (Junior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade) - Shojo (Senior Seventh Rank, Upper Grade) - Daisakan (Senior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade) - Shosakan (Junior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade).
Daizenshiki (Kunaisho)
Daizenshiki (Kunaisho)
Daizenshiki (Kunaisho)

sen.j: 河内職-道鏡政権下で河内国司にかわって設置
sen.e: Kawachishiki - Under the Dokyo administration, this was established to replace Kawachikokushi.
Kawachishiki - Under the Dokyo administration, this was established to replace Kawachikokushi.
Kawachishiki - Under the Dokyo administration, this was established to replace Kawachikokushi.

sen.j: 造宮職-宮殿造営の都度､設置
sen.e: Zogushiki - This was established at each time when a palace was built.
Zogushiki - This was established at each time when a palace was built.
Zogushiki - This was established at each time when a palace was built.
* Later, Daizenshiki was raised to Daishiki. Note: Kyoshiki and Settsushiki were ruling organizations of special areas.
* Later, Daizenshiki was raised to Daishiki.
sen.cmt: ruling organizations of --> governing organizations for ruling
sen.e: * Later, Daizenshiki was raised to Daishiki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 注京職と摂津職は特別地域の統治機構
sen.e: Note: Kyoshiki and Settsushiki were governing organizations for ruling special areas.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
